rounds.observation:
[GAME] You are Player 0 in Tic Tac Toe.
Your goal is to win three in a row (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally) on the board.
On your turn, you should select the square number (0-8) you want to put your mark in next.
For example, '[4]' places your mark in the center cell of the board.

As Player 0, you will be 'O', while your opponent is 'X'.

rounds.response:
After reviewing the current board and analyzing potential threats, I must prioritize blocking my opponent (Player 1, 'X') from winning immediately. The analysis reveals that Player 1 can win next turn by playing at cell 3, completing a vertical three-in-a-row in column 0 (cells 0, 3, 6). This is the only immediate winning threat on the board. Therefore, I must play at cell 3 to block this. While creating my own winning opportunities is important, defending against an immediate loss takes precedence here. By playing at cell 3, I also set up a potential win in row 1 (if I can take cell 5 later). 

My move: [3]

- Placing 'O' at position 5 completes the middle row (cells 3, 4, 5 → O, O, O), securing victory.  
No need to consider defensive moves since this ends the game.
